image.altText: Close-up of tail of a Virgin Australia aircraft at Brisbane Airport.

props.synopsis: The gender pay gap — the difference between what men and women are paid in the same organisation — is a stubborn problem. Now, explosive new data from a government agency lets 5 million workers know the gap at their employer.

title.children: Airlines, banks, footy clubs: The biggest gender pay gaps in Australia revealed in new data

image.altText: A collage of images showing abusive teachers who worked in Victorian government schools

props.synopsis: After six months examining decades of crimes against students in state-run schools, the government-initiated inquiry leading the investigation delivers its findings to the Victorian governor.

title.children: Horror stories of paedophile cluster at primary school barely scratch surface of crisis, survivors say

image.altText: Gail Kelsey smiling with a broad brimmed hat on.

props.synopsis: A man who killed his wife at their Logan home more than four years ago told police he'd shot her because she had "just waffled on too much" about his family, a Brisbane jury has heard.

title.children: A man shot his wife dead in Logan after listening to a lengthy 'barrage' about his family, jury hears

image.altText: Sydney Mardi Gras

props.synopsis: The board of the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras has requested that NSW Police not take part in this weekend's parade.

title.children: Sydney Mardi Gras board requests NSW Police not take part in parade

image.altText: A young Timor-leste woman in a pink shirt in a rural setting.

props.synopsis: It's been an area of dispute for centuries, and now hundreds of local farmers have been told that 270 hectares of land they use for farming will be handed over to Indonesia.

title.children: 'We're not coming to sit and drink coffee': Indonesia land dispute to climax as farmers say 'no'

image.altText: Gender pay gap  2024-02-21 11:02:00

props.synopsis: Government data shows women earn on average 21.7 per cent less than men, but will data show the real picture of pay disparity if it doesn't include small businesses?

title.children: Will regional women benefit from new gender pay gap data?

image.altText: Sydney couple luke davies and jesse baird were allegedly murdered on Monday February 19

props.synopsis: It's been almost a week since NSW Police began investigating the alleged double murder of Sydney couple Luke Davies and Jesse Baird. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: The hunt for the bodies of Luke Davies and Jesse Baird continues, but key questions remain unanswered

image.altText: A composite image of Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Vladimir Putin

props.synopsis: The war in Ukraine has reached its second anniversary, giving an opportunity to reflect on the costs and lessons. The most important aspect is the strategic goals held by the Ukrainian and Russian leaders, writes Mick Ryan.

title.children: There's no mystery about Putin's war aims as Ukraine battle enters its third year

image.altText: A covered slide for tourists in a green forest

props.synopsis: The unique sinkhole in Tasmania's remote north-west was meant to be a much-needed tourism drawcard for the area. Instead, the site has fallen into disrepair, leaving locals shocked at its condition.

title.children: It was to be a tourism draw card, but it's been 'left to rot' — and locals want to know why

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is a "terrifying" threat to democratic order thanks to his "creepy" embrace of autocrats like Vladimir Putin, according to former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull.

title.children: Trump's 'creepy' Putin relationship a threat, Turnbull says

image.altText: Side by side photos of Joe Biden in front of an American flag and Taylor Swift looking over her shoulder

props.synopsis: With the number of eyes fixed on Taylor Swift’s glittering ascension, any political figure who would dismiss her as a woman unaware of her own power — or unprepared to wield it — would be a fool, writes Julia Baird.

title.children: Fresh from conquering Australia, is Taylor Swift's next target the US election?

image.altText: A brown bird is airborne just off the ground facing off with a small penguin in a larger colony

props.synopsis: Scientists are concerned about the impact of a deadly strain of bird flu which has finally reached mainland Antarctica, leaving Australia as the last continent to be conquered.

title.children: Devastating bird flu detected on mainland Antarctica for the first time. Could it reach Australia?

image.altText: A man in a suit covers his face with a cap and a piece of fabric.

props.synopsis: Shinri Minatoya expressed his profound sorrow to the court over the 2019 deaths of the two Japanese exchange students in his care. No conviction was recorded, but he was ordered to pay a $55,000 fine.

title.children: 'I can't cope': Teacher pleads guilty over drownings of exchange students on K'gari

image.altText: Several people walk to a submerged car.

props.synopsis: The people of Tully are accustomed to wet weather, but the flooding rains on the weekend still came as a shock.

title.children: Surprise 458mm downpour washes out Australia's wettest town

image.altText: A man in a business shirt and tie looks seriously off the camera.

props.synopsis: Here's what happened when former Northern Territory police officer Zachary Rolfe took the stand for the first time in the coronial inquest into the 2019 police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker. WARNING: This story contains offensive language.

title.children: From racism claims to emotional scenes: The key moments of Zachary Rolfe's inquest evidence

image.altText: Swimmers at a hinterland waterfall and waterhole.

props.synopsis: A state coroner calls the death of the 13-year-old at a waterhole on the Gold Coast hinterland a "tragic accident", saying if the youth worker had tried to restrain the child the outcome "could have been much worse".

title.children: Inquest finds youth worker was right not to physically restrain boy who drowned while in residential care

image.altText: university cap graduation generic

props.synopsis: University students could get cost of living relief in the federal budget, with the education minister considering changes to HECS repayments and unpaid placements.

title.children: Could your student debt be about to change?

image.altText: Varroa mites on honey bee pupae.

props.synopsis: A solitary specimen of Varroa jacobsoni, which is a different species to the pest plaguing New South Wales and Victoria, was found during a routine inspection of a sentinel hive in Brisbane.

title.children: Varroa jacobsoni mite detected at the Port of Brisbane

image.altText: Antoinette Lattouf

props.synopsis: Former ABC radio presenter Antoinette Lattouf has escalated her unlawful termination case to the Federal Court, accusing the broadcaster of breaching its own employee agreement by dismissing her without due process.

title.children: Antoinette Lattouf files second legal case against ABC over dismissal

image.altText: Mohammad Shtayyeh's side profile

props.synopsis: Mohammed Shtayyeh says his government is resigning, in a move that could open the door to US-backed reforms in the Palestinian Authority.

title.children: Palestinian prime minister submits government's resignation

image.altText: An aerial view of burnt bushland and houses.

props.synopsis: A cattle farmer who is among a group suing the state-owned company tells the NSW Supreme Court that he repeatedly asked for trees to be cleared ahead of the destructive Tathra bushfire.

title.children: Bushfire victims take Essential Energy to Supreme Court over devastating 2018 bushfire

image.altText: People holding up signs in a protest

props.synopsis: South Korea's government tells young doctors they have until the end of February to return to work or risk being punished for staging a week-long protest that has disrupted services for patients at several major hospitals.

title.children: 'Go back to work, or else': South Korea's striking doctors given ultimatum by government

image.altText: An aerial view of Tuvalu.

props.synopsis: An experienced regional diplomat who helped Tuvalu craft the landmark Falepili Union with Australia has been appointed the Pacific nation's new prime minister.

title.children: Pacific nation expected to review security pact with Australia and Taiwan ties after choosing new PM

image.altText: A Malaysian 50 ringgit banknote with a handwritten message on left-hand side in Malay

props.synopsis: A Malaysian woman is reunited with the last bank note given to her by her late father thanks to a social media campaign and a stranger's generosity.

title.children: 'Last money from Dad': Daughter retrieves final bank note gifted from late father after four years

image.altText: Black and white photo of young girl with stern expression holding one hand in her other, with parents smiling either side.

props.synopsis: When Miranda Jakich was 14, her father left her alone in a Russian hospital to have experimental surgery. What she experienced was so traumatic it shaped the rest of her life.

title.children: A belief in Soviet miracles led Miranda's father to send her to Moscow for experimental surgery she never wanted

image.altText: A woman on a stretcher being taken out of a helicopter.

props.synopsis: A woman in her 40s has been taken to hospital following a suspected shark attack near Jurien Bay, north of Perth.

title.children: Woman in critical condition after suspected shark attack near Jurien Bay

image.altText: A house sits in high flood waters.

props.synopsis: In the lead-up to next month's Brisbane City Council election, the Greens have announced they would ban new developments in certain flood zones in the city – but the idea has been criticised by the LNP and Labor.

title.children: Greens push for ban on new developments in Brisbane flood zones in council election promise

image.altText: A man in a suit without a tie stands speaking, gesturing with one hand.

props.synopsis: The Greens say they will not support the government's shared equity housing scheme to pay for up to 40 per cent of a home unless it cuts tax discounts for property investors and does more for renters.

title.children: Greens threaten to sink help-to-buy housing scheme as government resists negative gearing reform

image.altText: A man and a woman walk through a cloud of smoke.

props.synopsis: Hospital staff reported seeing Dougie Hampson "writhing in pain" when he presented to Dubbo Base Hospital, an inquest into his death has heard.

title.children: Inquest hears of 'false diagnosis' of Indigenous man, who died 24 hours after discharge from hospital

image.altText: A group of racing tyres lie on the ground during practice ahead of a race.

props.synopsis: New Zealand motorsport is in mourning after the death of a 15-year-old driver and his 35-year-old co-driver in a crash during a rallysprint event in the country's north.

title.children: 15-year-old driver one of two killed in New Zealand rallysprint driving crash

image.altText: Turvey family on holiday

props.synopsis: Mechelle Turvey went through the worst thing a mother can endure. When the senseless death of her 15-year-old son Cassius Turvey ignited fury across the nation, she instead called for peace and unity.

title.children: Mechelle Turvey has had to face the unimaginable as a mother. This is how she copes
